intro: Cliffortia juniperina var. foliis-brevioribus, commonly known as the short-leaved cliffortia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its compact growth habit and attractive foliage make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. The species is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
